par.text: Thallium is a soft, grey metal. It is not resistant to atmospheric exposure and combines with oxygen to produce thallium(II) oxide TlO and thallium(III) oxide – T

; it reacts with water to form thallium(I) hydroxide - TlOH. Thallium dissolves in acids to produce salts. Thallium and its compounds are toxic; they impart an emerald-green colour to a flame. The element was discovered by an English chemist William Crookes. Its name is derived from the Greek word thallos - ”green twig”.
